summary: The College Thriving Act directs the Secretary of Education to award grants to eligible institutions of higher education to implement skills-for-success courses for all first-year students. The bill prioritizes institutions with a high percentage of Pell Grant recipients. Grants are for a 5-year period and require institutions to develop and pilot the course, then fully implement it, evaluating its impact. The program aims to help students develop skills needed to succeed in college.  $50 million is authorized for appropriations.
